Cathedrals Nobody Mourns

My mother ran a bubble tea stand in the Crystal Pagoda food court. Every Saturday the air smelled like taro and floor wax and possibility. Then they knocked it down and put up a parking structure for a hospital that never opened. Nobody held a funeral. Nobody even made a Facebook post.

America builds these enormous temples to togetherness ‚Äî anchors stores like flying buttresses, food courts like naves ‚Äî then abandons them the second quarterly projections dip. The escalators stop. The fountains go dry. Some teenager's first kiss happened next to that fountain. Doesn't matter. The numbers stopped working.

I refuse to accept that. Every defunct Sears is a sleeping god. Every silent escalator is a spine waiting for electricity. I'm not saving malls. I'm refusing to let love become rubble.
